channel.title: [VB6] Web Browser Tutorial!
channel.description:
[u][size=10pt][b]Creating a Web Browser in Visual Basic 6[/b][/size][/u]
Step 1.
Create a new project in Visual Basic 6.
Step 2.
Right click on your toolbox and click on Components.
[img]http://xs218.xs.to/xs218/07314/Component1.png[/img]
Step 3.
Scroll down and select these two controls, then click OK.
[img]http://xs218.xs.to/xs218/07314/Component2.png[/img]
Step 4.
You should have two new tools like this
[img]http://xs218.xs.to/xs218/07314/NewThings.png[/img]
The one that looks like earth is a Web Browser Control, and the other is a Inet control.
Step 5.
Now, put the following on your form.
Textbox Name: address Command Button Name: go Caption: Go Command Button Name: back Caption: Back Command Button Name: forward Caption: Forward Command Button Name: refresh Caption: Refresh Command Button Name: stop Caption: Stop Command Button Name: source Caption: View Source Web Browser control Name: web Inet Control Name: grabsource
Step 6.
Arrange them like this:
[img]http://xs218.xs.to/xs218/07314/LookLike.png[/img]
Step 7.
As the code for them, put this.
[img]http://xs218.xs.to/xs218/07314/Code_Main.png[/img]
Step 8.
Okay, now we add a new form, and rename form1 to main, and our new one form2 to Sourcecode
[img]http://xs218.xs.to/xs218/07314/Forms.png[/img]
Step 9.
Ok so double click on our new form named Sourcecode.
Add the following:
Textbox Name: source Multiline: Yes Font: Times New Roman Command Button Name: srefresh Caption: Refresh
Step 10.
It should look like this:
[img]http://xs218.xs.to/xs218/07314/Source.png[/img]
Step 11.
Then add the following code:
[img]http://xs218.xs.to/xs218/07314/SourceCODE.png[/img]
Step 12.
Your now finished with your webbrowser!!
Thank you for reading! =]

item.title: [VB6] Web Browser Tutorial!
item.dc:creator: @sdouble sdouble
item.description:
@sdouble wrote:

A decent tutorial. Like it’s been said, very easy to do but just as well for someone that’s never used VB. This way, you show people how little effort it takes to make something like a web browser (it is IE based, mind you) with so little code. Also, if you’re going to post a tutorial, please code it properly. Use indents so people can read the code better and make sure it is correctly coded. Running the program before posting it all would be a good idea. =]

If you’re going to show someone how to do something, show them right. Nice contribution though. I highly recommend not starting programming with VB, it will teach you all the wrong things. Trust me, I went down that road.

Read full topic

item.title: [VB6] Web Browser Tutorial!
item.dc:creator: @Daed Daed
item.description:
@Daed wrote:

Sorry about the error guys, i have only just come back to visual basic after a long long break : )

To fix this, make a new line above the ‘error:’ in the code, and put ‘exit sub’ in the line.

EG:

On Error goto Error:
web.GoForward
exit sub
Error:
msgbox "Could not go forward",vbinformation,"Error"

Read full topic

item.title: [VB6] Web Browser Tutorial!
item.dc:creator: @Daed Daed
item.description:
@Daed wrote:

[size=10pt]Creating a Web Browser in Visual Basic 6[/size]

Step 1.

                      Create a new project in Visual Basic 6.

Step 2.

                       Right click on your toolbox and click on Components.

                       [img]http://xs218.xs.to/xs218/07314/Component1.png[/img]

Step 3.

                        Scroll down and select these two controls, then click OK.

                        [img]http://xs218.xs.to/xs218/07314/Component2.png[/img]

Step 4.

                         You should have two new tools like this

                          [img]http://xs218.xs.to/xs218/07314/NewThings.png[/img]

                           The one that looks like earth is a Web Browser Control, and the other is a Inet control.

Step 5.

                        Now, put the following on your form.

                        Textbox                          Name: address
                        Command Button              Name: go                               Caption: Go
                        Command Button              Name: back                            Caption: Back
                        Command Button              Name: forward                        Caption: Forward
                        Command Button              Name: refresh                         Caption: Refresh
                        Command Button              Name: stop                            Caption: Stop
                        Command Button              Name: source                         Caption: View Source
                        Web Browser control         Name: web
                        Inet Control                     Name: grabsource

Step 6.

                     Arrange them like this:

                     [img]http://xs218.xs.to/xs218/07314/LookLike.png[/img]

Step 7.

                      As the code for them, put this.

                      [img]http://xs218.xs.to/xs218/07314/Code_Main.png[/img]

Step 8.

                       Okay, now we add a new form, and rename form1 to main, and our new one form2 to Sourcecode

                       [img]http://xs218.xs.to/xs218/07314/Forms.png[/img]

Step 9.

                        Ok so double click on our new form named Sourcecode.

                        Add the following:

                        Textbox                          Name: source                                 Multiline: Yes                     Font: Times New Roman
                        Command Button              Name: srefresh                               Caption: Refresh

Step 10.

                        It should look like this:

                        [img]http://xs218.xs.to/xs218/07314/Source.png[/img]

Step 11.

                         Then add the following code:

                         [img]http://xs218.xs.to/xs218/07314/SourceCODE.png[/img]

Step 12.

                         Your now finished with your webbrowser!!

                         Thank you for reading! =]

Read full topic
